intro: Schmaltzia ovata, commonly known as the ovalleaf schmaltzia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Schmaltzia ovata is often found in coastal areas and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
